executive_summary: While appliance sales dipped in the immediate wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, a surge in home renovation projects and a strong residential construction market boosted demand for major home appliances. As stay-at-home measures persisted into 2020, consumers, aided by federal stimulus packages, took on home renovation projects as more time was spent at home. Similarly, strong demand for new homes led to increased housing starts, further increasing demand for new home appliances.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Housing Market Activity Encouraged Consumers to Purchase New Appliances
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The real estate market experienced a significant expansion in 2021 as part of the broader economic recovery from the impacts of the pandemic. This revival subsequently led to a spike in visits to appliance stores as consumers sought to equip homes with new kitchen and laundry appliances. The swift expansion in the number of remote employees has encouraged numerous families and individuals to seek out single-family homes in the suburbs. This boost in housing market activity has enticed consumers to purchase new appliances, providing benefits to the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Accelerated E-Commerce Sales, Disrupting the Industry's Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers flocked to online retailers at an unprecedented rate because of temporary store closures, social distancing measures and health concerns in 2020. Prior to the pandemic, consumers generally didn't purchase large high-profit appliances online; however, pandemic restrictions reduced hesitancy and forced buyers to research and purchase home appliances via e-commerce sites. Amid appliance shortages and price increases, online retailers enabled buyers to search more readily for in-stock items and competitive prices.

Intense competition from major appliance retailers, including Lowe's and Best Buy, has constrained profit growth. Major retailers benefit from economies of scale and established supplier relationships, enabling them to pass cost savings on big-ticket items, like laundry machines, down to the consumer. Intensifying competition has led to aggressive discounting by the industry to offer prices comparable with those offered by larger sellers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Economy Will Expand, Contributing to Growth in Household Appliance Revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The increasing disposable incomes and the forecast drop in unemployment will continue to furnish homeowners with more spendable money, thereby stimulating stronger home investment. As such investment intensifies, demand for household appliances will rise.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rebate Programs Will Boost Demand for Energy-Efficient Appliances
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: US consumers' commitment to the environment will play a larger part in their selection of home appliance products over the next five years. Consumers have already started actively seeking out and purchasing items with lower energy use, less water consumption and greater recyclability. The federal government's expired Energy-Efficient Appliance Rebate Program supported this trend early in the previous five years. This program heightened consumers' awareness of green appliances. Consequently, consumer household appliance stores will face increased sales of energy-efficient appliances over the coming five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Growth in E-Commerce Will Disadvantage the Existence of Household Appliance Stores
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising competition from digital retailers will likely push smaller retailers out of the industry as they struggle to compete against the lower prices and the accessibility of their online counterparts. With advancements in technology and enhancements in user experience, the ease of online shopping will continue to climb within the e-commerce industry, leading to expanded customer bases and increased overall sales.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry retail new household appliances, like refrigerators, coffee makers, air-conditioners and vacuum cleaners. In addition to selling appliances, many stores offer delivery, installation and repair services.
key_trends: The 2021 real estate boom triggered increased appliance purchases, benefiting the industry. However, competition from major retailers, like Lowe's and Best Buy, led to aggressive discounting, constraining profit growth.

Forecast economic growth, increased disposable income and lower unemployment rates will stimulate household appliance revenue. But online retailers face stiff competition from physical appliance stores because of advanced technology and competitive pricing.

State-specific regulations govern the retail sector. Companies must comply with antitrust, the Fair Labor Standards Act, workplace laws and the Americans with Disabilities Act, ensuring accessibility for disabled customers.

The US government promotes energy efficiency within the appliance industry through strategic policies and incentives; this fosters demand and accessibility for high-quality, Energy Star-certified products, ultimately benefiting consumers and industry operators.

Supply chain disruptions have impacted major laundry appliances, prompting quality prioritization because of resource scarcity. Meanwhile, pandemic-induced remote work has surged demand for small household appliances amid rising e-commerce competition.

The majority of consumers in this category are employed individuals with steady incomes. As a result, they can often spend more on big-ticket items. Consumers in this group are more likely to have their own families and homes, making them an ideal market for the industry.
This segment primarily consists of young professionals looking to furnish their first homes and families who are trending towards technology.
This segment primarily comprises baby boomers who have their homes well-equipped with appliances and have different purchasing habits.
This group contains the youngest consumers, often limited by lower disposable income.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Sluggish Growth in Number of US Households
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The sluggish growth in the number of US households, because of unstable economic conditions led to a stagnation in demand for new, major kitchen appliances over much of the period.
Challenges in the global supply chain, driven by factors like shipping delays and material shortages, have been impacting the major laundry appliances segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Pandemic Increased Demand for Small Appliances
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The pandemic has significantly increased demand for small household appliances as most individuals and professionals work from home.

The economic fluctuations in 2022 and 2023 have significantly impacted consumer spending habits, prompting many individuals to repair their household appliances instead of purchasing new ones. Technological advancements expand the need for expert assistance in maintaining and repairing sophisticated household gadgets.
